subject: Re: [junit] Support for Swing and Applets ???
msgSnippet: I was just about to send out a question on this JFC testing. :) Through getComponents() method in Container class, one can always get all the widget classes
messageBody:
I was just about to send out a question on this JFC testing. :)

Through getComponents() method in Container class, one can always get all the widget classes contained in a window. So by making
all the component variables private, I realize that I am just causing trouble for myself, since it doesn't hide them after all. So
nowadays I make all my widget memeber variables (JButton, JLabel, JTextField, etc.) pakcage private so that my testing classes can
access them easily. My other fields are still private.

This has worked out pretty good for me for all the UI testings, but I am just a little bit concerned about the package private
variables.

Is there anyone doing the same thing? Or is there a better solution?
